info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 30 at 3:00PM CDT until March 30 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 PM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN CHICOT COUNTY...EASTERN EAST CARROLL PARISH... SOUTHWESTERN WASHINGTON...NORTHWESTERN ISSAQUENA AND SHARKEY COUNTIES... At 300 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms capable of producing tornadoes were located along a line extending from near Wayside to near Glen Allan to Fitler, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. These dangerous storms will be near... Panther Burn and Nitta Yuma around 305 PM CDT. Rolling Fork around 315 PM CDT. Anguilla around 320 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by these tornadic storms include Mayersville and Cary. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
